intro: Schiedea globosa, commonly known as the globe curlcup, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Schiedea globosa is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species. Its botanical features make it an important part of Hawaii's native flora and ecological diversity.
